intro: Cleomella hillmanii var. hillmanii, commonly known as the Hillman's cleomella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species characterized by its erect stems and alternate leaves that are often lanceolate or ovate in shape. The flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive spurred structure at the base of the calyx. It produces small, round, greenish-black seeds enclosed in a capsule, which is a characteristic feature of the Cleomaceae family. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
